intro: Medinilla bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan medinilla, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is shrub-like, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland forests and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
